column4: with rhythmbox and my sons mp3 player, I cannot remove tracks.  It is a regular usb mass storage device player, not mtp.  The Remove and Move to Trash selections are ghosted out on the context menu for single tracks I want to remove
i tried googling, but saw nothing pertinant
it's mounted as a usb drive?
check the ownership of the mount point :)
its mounted by udev to /dev/media, and is uid has 700 permissions on the mountpoint
so you the user do not have read/write rights to it
sudo chmod 770 to the mount point directory
im logged in as him right now.  he's 10, so he doesnt have sudo or anything.  he has it mounted, and he remove tracks in rhythmbox
you need to change the permission of the mount point to allow you to write to it
he is logged in, he has 700, so he can write to it, and he cannot delete tracks
im sure he could do it in bash, but im trying to troubleshoot rhythmbox
700 is read/write/exec for root only
heres the mountpoint: drwx------ 16 joey root 4096 1969-12-31 19:00 disk
the user joey looks okay there
Joey does NOT have permissions on that directory
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FilePermissions
700 says owner has rwx, group and world has none.
the mountpoint i pasted says joey owns it
from the terminal type chmod joey;joey /media/disk -- if that's the mount point
do you mean chown joey:joey?  joey is already the owner, root is the group owner.
with no changes to mountpoint, the user joey can delete files individually in bash.

i found this nugget in the rhythmbox docs"At this time, Rhythmbox can only read information but cannot write (like tags modification, tracks deletion or copy track from Rhythmbox Music Player to your player)."
